result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Adam L Bladow was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Adam L Bladow was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1519  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia, alcohol and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and written approval of agent & IID.  Maintain absolute sobriety. May not live anywhere there is alcohol. May not hold in hand alcohol. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.
Must be in treatment, counseling or support groups at all times. 1st 6 mo to be on sobrietor.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$33 blood draw cost  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 24 mo.

superMiscConds.notes: $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 3.
